intro: Uebelmannia meninensis var. rubra, commonly known as the red-flowered meninensis, is a rare and striking plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its spatheous inflorescence, which consists of a showy petal-like structure surrounding the true flowers. The plant is notable for its vivid red spathes, which contrast sharply with its dark green foliage, making it a visually striking species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
